quiz.text: Main function of religious structure is
options: Replacement of population
Socialization of new population
It reinforces social unity
Production and distribution of goods and services
None of the above

quiz.text: "India is a country of rich heritage and cultural diversity." Which one of the following facts best supports the claim made in the above sentence?
options: India is a union of 28 states and 8 union territories.
India has a population of over 1.1 billion.
India is home to 22 official languages and thousands of dialects.
The Indian cricket team draws players from over ten states.
None of the above

quiz.text: What is included in the culture?
options: Language that enables humans to communicate with members in society.
Adapts to changing backgrounds and develops itself.
A set of principles and traditions is passed down from generation to generation, yet because humans have created it naturally, culture tends to be liberal and changeable.
Makes economic sense and decisions in financial matters.
None of the above

quiz.text: Discrimination based on a person's language is known as
options: Linguism
Regionalism
Caste - ism
Communalism
Secularism

quiz.text: Forcible Religious conversions violate which of the following Fundamental right?
options: Freedom of conscience
Right to profess
Right to practice
Right to propagate
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding communalism.
  1. The first stage of communalism is Liberal Communalism
  2. The second stage of communalism is Communal Consciousness
  3. The third stage of communalism is Extreme Communalism
Which of the above statements are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
1 and 2 Only
2 and 3 Only

quiz.text: Secularism means __________
options: The State is to give patronage to any one religion.
Respect all religions without favouring any one religion.
Lacking religious emotion, doctrines and practices.
To impose any particular religion upon the rest of the people.
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following fundamental right(s) is/are guaranteed by the Constitution?
  1. Right to practice and propagate religion
  2. Right to convert the religion of people 
  3. Right to establish and maintain institutions for religious and charitable purposes
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All of the above
1 and 2 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Right to Freedom of Religion under the Constitution of India:
  1. The government is empowered to provide for the opening of Hindu religious institutions of a public character to all classes and sections of Hindus.
  2. Every religious denomination has the right to own and acquire movable and immovable property.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?0
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: According to Article 25 - 28 of Fundamental Rights, find the incorrect statements about it from below:
options: No religious instructions shall be provided in any educational institution wholly funded by the state.
Secularism is the basic feature of the Constitution
The state shall not compel any person to pay any taxes which shall be used to promote and maintain any particular religion.
This right is available to Indian citizens only.
Article 25 deals with Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice, and propagation of religion

quiz.text: Given below are two statements:  Statement I: As per the preamble to the constitution, India is a secular country.  Statement II: Setting up educational institutions by religious minority communities is against the constitution.  In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :
options: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Statement II is the correct explanation of statement I

quiz.text: With the reference to the Communal politics belief, which of the statements is correct?
options: One religion is superior to that of others.
People belonging to different religions can live together happily as equal citizens. .
Followers of a different religion constitute one community.
State power cannot be used to establish the domination of one religious group over others
It generates mutual trust between religious communities.

quiz.text: Which ideology threatens Indian Unity?
options: Communalism
Communism
Democracy
Socialism
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not one of the of the five basic characteristics of culture?
options: Culture is learned
Culture is passed down
Culture is shared
Culture is integrated
Culture is dynamic

quiz.text: Regionalism is the main cause of
options: Poverty
Social tensions
Unemployment
Globalisation
Inflation

quiz.text: The culture of India is the oldest culture of the world around 5,000 years. Indian culture is considered as the first and supreme culture of the world. There is a common saying about India that “Unity in Diversity” means India is a diverse country where people of many religions live together peacefully with their own separate cultures. People of various religions differ in their language, food tradition, rituals, etc however they live with unity. The widely spoken language of India is Hindi however there are almost 22 official languages and 400 other languages are spoken daily in India in its various states and territories. According to the history, India has been recognized as the birthplace of the religions like Hinduism and Buddhism. Huge population of the India belongs to the Hindu religion. Other variations of the Hinduism are Shaiva, Shakteya, Vaishnava and Smarta.  Q .The process by which children develop habits, skills, values and motives that make them responsible, productive members of society is called
options: Socialization
Inclusion
Mainstreaming
Differentiation
None of the above

quiz.text: The culture of India is the oldest culture of the world around 5,000 years. Indian culture is considered as the first and supreme culture of the world. There is a common saying about India that “Unity in Diversity” means India is a diverse country where people of many religions live together peacefully with their own separate cultures. People of various religions differ in their language, food tradition, rituals, etc however they live with unity. The widely spoken language of India is Hindi however there are almost 22 official languages and 400 other languages are spoken daily in India in its various states and territories. According to the history, India has been recognized as the birthplace of the religions like Hinduism and Buddhism. A huge population of India belongs to the Hindu religion. Other variations of Hinduism are Shaiva, Shakteya, Vaishnava, and Smarta. Q. Below are given a number of concepts in List- I and their descriptions in List - II. Match the items in List - I with that of List  - II :
options: A - 2, B - 1, C - 4, D - 3
A - 1, B - 3, C - 5, D - 2
A - 4, B - 5, C - 2, D - 1
A - 3, B - 2, C - 1, D - 4
A - 5, B - 3, C - 2, D - 4

quiz.text:
The culture of India is the oldest culture of the world around 5,000 years. Indian culture is considered as the first and supreme culture of the world. There is a common saying about India that “Unity in Diversity” means India is a diverse country where people of many religions live together peacefully with their own separate cultures. People of various religions differ in their language, food tradition, rituals, etc however they live with unity. The widely spoken language of India is Hindi however there are almost 22 official languages and 400 other languages are spoken daily in India in its various states and territories. According to the history, India has been recognized as the birthplace of the religions like Hinduism and Buddhism. Huge population of the India belongs to the Hindu religion. Other variations of the Hinduism are Shaiva, Shakteya, Vaishnava and Smarta. Q. Which of the following statements are correct in the context of agents of socialization:
  1. The agents or agencies of socialization are those institutions that contribute to the process of socialization of an individual. 
  2. The secondary agents of socialization include family members and relatives as the child begins to interact with them since his birth. 
  3. The primary agents of socialization include those institutions which help a child in his socialization in the later years of his life and continues throughout his life.
Which of the following statements are correct ?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
1 and 2 only
All of the above

quiz.text: The culture of India is the oldest culture in the world around 5,000 years. Indian culture is considered as the first and supreme culture of the world. There is a common saying about India that “Unity in Diversity” means India is a diverse country where people of many religions live together peacefully with their own separate cultures. People of various religions differ in their language, food tradition, rituals, etc however they live with unity. The widely spoken language of India is Hindi however there are almost 22 official languages and 400 other languages are spoken daily in India in its various states and territories. According to the history, India has been recognized as the birthplace of the religions like Hinduism and Buddhism. A huge population of India belongs to the Hindu religion. Other variations of Hinduism are Shaiva, Shakteya, Vaishnava, and Smarta. Q. Which one of the following is an incorrect pair?
options: Melting pot: USA
Boiling pot: Israel
Salad bowl: India
Fruit bowl: UK
None of the above

quiz.text: The culture of India is the oldest culture of the world around 5,000 years. Indian culture is considered as the first and supreme culture of the world. There is a common saying about India that “Unity in Diversity” means India is a diverse country where people of many religions live together peacefully with their own separate cultures. People of various religions differ in their language, food tradition, rituals, etc however they live with unity. The widely spoken language of India is Hindi however there are almost 22 official languages and 400 other languages are spoken daily in India in its various states and territories. According to the history, India has been recognized as the birthplace of the religions like Hinduism and Buddhism. Huge population of the India belongs to the Hindu religion. Other variations of the Hinduism are Shaiva, Shakteya, Vaishnava and Smarta. Q. Process of socialization does not include:
options: Learning the customs and norms of a culture
Acquisition of skills
Acquiring values and beliefs
Genetic transmission
